get.summary: This endpoint returns the data for a transaction to place a cross-chain DLN order.
get.description: This endpoint returns the data for a transaction to place a cross-chain DLN order.

parameters.name: srcChainId
parameters.description: An ID of a source chain, a chain where the cross-chain swap will start

parameters.name: srcChainTokenIn
parameters.description: An address (on a source chain) of an input token to swap

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: srcChainTokenInAmount
parameters.description: An amount of input tokens to swap

recomended.summary: Use a recommended srcChainTokenInAmount calculated upon request

max.summary: Use a maximum possible srcChainTokenInAmount calculated upon request

parameters.name: dstChainId
parameters.description: An ID of a destination chain, a chain where the cross-chain swap will finish. Must differ from `srcChainId`!

parameters.name: dstChainTokenOut
parameters.description: An address (on a destination chain) of a target token.

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: dstChainTokenOutAmount
parameters.description: Amount of the target asset the market maker expects to receive upon order fulfillment. This property can be set to "auto" so that the API will suggest the best possible outcome of the order based on current market conditions and the protocol fees, keeping the order in a reasonable-to-fullfill state

recomended.summary: Use a recommended dstChainTokenOutAmount calculated upon request (default)

parameters.name: additionalTakerRewardBps
parameters.description: `additionalTakerRewardBps` is additionally laid in on top of default taker margin.

parameters.name: srcIntermediaryTokenAddress
parameters.description: An address (on a source chain) of an intermediary token a user's input funds should be swapped to prior order creation. This token must be publicly traded and listed on major DEX aggregators. Examples: USDC on Ethereum, DAI on Ethereum, USDC on Solana. This property can be either a Circle-issued USDC token or ETH, or an arbitrary token; setting an arbitrary token also requires you to specify `dstIntermediaryTokenAddress`, `intermediaryTokenUSDPrice` and `dstIntermediaryTokenSpenderAddress`  properties as well.

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: dstIntermediaryTokenAddress
parameters.description: An address (on a destination chain) of an intermediary token whose value assumed to be equal to the value of `srcIntermediaryTokenAddress` . This token must be publicly traded and listed on major DEX aggregators.  Examples: USDC on Ethereum, DAI on Ethereum, USDC on Solana. Setting this property also requires you to specify `srcIntermediaryTokenAddress`, `intermediaryTokenUSDPrice` and `dstIntermediaryTokenSpenderAddress` properties as well.

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: dstIntermediaryTokenSpenderAddress
parameters.description: Applicable to a EVM-compatible destination chain. An address (on a EVM-compatible destination chain) assumed as a spender of the intermediary token (set as `dstIntermediaryTokenAddress`) during order fulfillment. This address must hold a reasonable amount (of at least $100 in value for testing purposes, or at least 10% of the average order value) of the given intermediary token, and issue on-chain approvals to spent the given  intermediary token by the two trusted DLN contracts (DlnDestination: {CURRENT_ENV[dstChain].pmmDst} and CrosschainForwarder: {CURRENT_ENV[dstChain].evm.forwarderContract}). This property is required when `srcIntermediaryTokenAddress` and `dstIntermediaryTokenAddress` are set.

parameters.name: intermediaryTokenUSDPrice
parameters.description: A value (a spot price) of the given intermediary token expressed in US dollars. Keep in mind this price is not used to calculate the spread of an order, but only as a reference price for operating expenses incurred by a taker during and after order fulfillment. The order spread is still calculated using the market price quoted from a major DEX.

parameters.name: dstChainTokenOutRecipient
parameters.description: Address (on the destination chain) where target tokens should be transferred to after the swap. **Required for transaction construction**, otherwise only the quote is returned!

parameters.name: senderAddress
parameters.description: Address (on the source chain) who submits input tokens for a cross-chain swap

parameters.name: srcChainOrderAuthorityAddress
parameters.description: Address (on the source chain) who submits input tokens for a cross-chain swap. **Required for transaction construction**, otherwise only the quote is returned!

parameters.name: srcAllowedCancelBeneficiary
parameters.description: Fixed recipient of the funds of an order in case it is being cancelled. If not set, the recipient could be set later upon order cancellation.

parameters.name: referralCode
parameters.description:
Make sure you pass your referral code which can be generated here: https://app.debridge.finance/refer
With your referral code, your address will earn an additional 25% of deBridge points (https://debridge.finance/blog/introducing-debridge-points/), on top of the points generated by users who engage in activity on deBridge through your referral.

parameters.name: affiliateFeePercent
parameters.description:
The share of the input amount to be distributed to the `affiliateFeeRecipient` (if given) address as an affiliate fee.



If you are building on top of deSwap, you might want to take a small fee relative to the amount of a token a user provides for a swap. To achieve this, set this parameter to a desired % (e.g. `0.1` stands for 0.1%; the max value is `10` which stands for 10% of `srcAmountInParam`) and specify your wallet address in the `affiliateFeeRecipient` parameter.



For example, setting this parameter to `0.1` means that when the user gives 5000 USDT then you will receive 5 USDT immediately after transaction is being confirmed.

parameters.name: affiliateFeeRecipient
parameters.description: An address (on an origin chain) that will receive affiliate fees according to the `affiliateFeePercent` parameter.

parameters.name: srcChainTokenInSenderPermit
parameters.description: Typically, a sender is required to approve token transfer to deBridge forwarder for further transfer and swap. For gas-less cases, a sender-signed permit message may be provided to be executed by deBridge forwarder before actual transfer.

parameters.name: dstChainOrderAuthorityAddress
parameters.description: Address on the destination chain whom should be granted the privileges to manage the order (patch, cancel, etc). **Required for transaction construction**, otherwise only the quote is returned!

parameters.name: enableEstimate
parameters.description:
This flag forces deSwap API to validate the resulting transaction and estimate its gas consumption. You will find the estimation at `tx.gasLimit` field of the resulting object.

**Important:** to estimate a transaction, you are required to fill the `senderAddress` property with the address that will be used to execute this transaction. It should have enough assets on its balance to cover the amount specified in the `srcChainTokenInAmount` property, and enough ether to cover the protocol global fixed fee.

**Caution:** if the input token (`srcChainTokenIn`) is not a native blockchain currency but an ERC-20 token, it is necessary to provide an approve to spend this token by the `tx.allowanceTarget` contract prior to such estimation. This can be done either by executing `increaseAllowance()` on-chain or by providing the permit envelope via the `srcChainTokenInSenderPermit` property. Failing to provide a correct approve to spend will result an error during transaction.

parameters.name: allowedTaker
parameters.description: An address (on a destination chain) of a allowed taker.

parameters.name: externalCall
dlnHook
prependOperatingExpenses
parameters.description: Tells API server to prepend operating expenses to the input amount

parameters.name: otc
parameters.description: Forces a P2P order where input and output tokens are left intact(renamed to ptp)

parameters.name: ptp
parameters.description: Forces a P2P order where input and output tokens are left intact

parameters.name: skipSolanaRecipientValidation
parameters.description: Skip system address validation `dstChainTokenOutRecipient` in Solana

parameters.name: srcChainPriorityLevel
parameters.description: Configures the priority level for transaction fee estimation.

400.description:
The request is malformed, has missing parameters, or has incorrect or contradicting parameter values. Possible error ids: 

  
        - INVALID_QUERY_PARAMETERS
  
  
        - SOURCE_AND_DESTINATION_CHAINS_ARE_EQUAL
  
  
        - AFFILIATE_FEE_PERCENT_NOT_SET
  
  
        - AFFILIATE_FEE_RECIPIENT_NOT_SET
  
  
        - ESTIMATION_FAILED
  
  
        - ERROR_LOW_GIVE_AMOUNT
  
  
        - UNSUPPORTED_TOKEN_IN
  
  
        - UNSUPPORTED_TOKEN_OUT
  
  
        - SENDER_ADDRESS_EMPTY
  
  
        - IMPOSSIBLE_ROUTE
  
  
        - INTERMEDIARY_TOKEN_NOT_FUNDED
  
  
        - INTERMEDIARY_TOKEN_APPROVALS_MISSING
  
  
        - INTERMEDIARY_TOKEN_NOT_CONFIGURED
  
  
        - SAME_SOURCE_AND_DESTINATION_CHAINS
  
  
        - UNABLE_TO_ESTIMATE_EXTERNAL_CALL_WITHOUT_GAS

500.description:
The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle. Possible error ids: 
  
        - INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
  
  
        - INTERNAL_SDK_ERROR

get.summary: Generates a transaction that cancels the given order
get.description: This endpoint generates a transaction that cancels the given order. This transaction must be published to the destination chain of the order. Unlocked funds would be transferred to the address specified as the orderAuthority of the given order on the source chain. This transaction can only be executed by th orderAuthority of the given order on the destination chain

400.description:
The request is malformed, has missing parameters, or has incorrect or contradicting parameter values. Possible error ids: 
  
        - INVALID_QUERY_PARAMETERS
  
  
        - UNKNOWN_ORDER
  
  
        - ORDER_ALREADY_FULFILLED
  
  
        - ORDER_ALREADY_CANCELLED

500.description:
The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle. Possible error ids: 
  
        - INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
  
  
        - INTERNAL_SDK_ERROR

get.summary: Generates a transaction that cancels external call in the given order
get.description: This endpoint generates a transaction that cancels external call in the given order.

400.description:

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: ID of a chain

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: An ID of a chain, a chain where the swap must be performed

parameters.name: tokenIn
parameters.description: An address of an input token to swap

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: tokenInAmount
parameters.description: An amount of input tokens to swap

parameters.name: slippage
parameters.description: A slippage constraint (in %) is a safeguard during swaps (on both source and destination chains, if applicable). It is also used to calculate the minimum possible outcome during estimation. This property can be set to "auto" so that the API will suggest the best possible slippage.

parameters.name: tokenOut
parameters.description: An address of a target token.

usdc.summary: USDC token on the Ethereum chain

native.summary: Native coin (e.g., ETH on Ethereum, BNB on BNB Chain)

parameters.name: affiliateFeePercent
parameters.description:
The share of the input amount to be distributed to the `affiliateFeeRecipient` (if given) address as an affiliate fee.
 

 
If you are building on top of deSwap, you might want to take a small fee relative to the amount of a token a user provides for a swap. To achieve this, set this parameter to a desired % (e.g. `0.1` stands for 0.1%; the max value is `10` which stands for 10% of `srcAmountInParam`) and specify your wallet address in the `affiliateFeeRecipient` parameter.
 

 
For example, setting this parameter to `0.1` means that when the user gives 5000 USDT then you will receive 5 USDT immediately after transaction is being confirmed.

parameters.name: affiliateFeeRecipient
parameters.description: An address (on an origin chain) that will receive affiliate fees according to the `affiliateFeePercent` parameter. For solana affiliate fee you have to create & provide Jupiter's referral key (https://referral.jup.ag/dashboard).

parameters.name: senderAddress
parameters.description: Address (on the source chain) who submits input tokens for a cross-chain swap

info.title: deBridge Liquidity Network (DLN) API
info.description:
A turnkey solution for a high-performance cross-chain trading

Quick Start Guide
